article.title: Delta
article.p:
Delta
, district municipality, southwestern
British Columbia
,
Canada
. It is situated in the southern Vancouver metropolitan area, between the Fraser River delta and Boundary Bay (an arm of the Strait of Georgia). Though its northern section is primarily residential, much of its area is devoted to dairying, truck gardening, and farming cash crops. Delta’s industries, which are mainly concentrated on Annacis Island in the Fraser River, include fishing and fish canning, food processing, and paper milling. Robert Bank, a superport built for the bulk handling of coal and completed in 1970, occupies a 55-acre (22-hectare) man-made island in the Strait of Georgia off the suburb’s western shore. Delta has several fine beaches and ferry service to Vancouver Island. Inc. 1879. Pop. (2006) 96,635; (2011) 99,863.
